title:
Symmetries of $(2,3,5)$-distributions and associated Legendrian cone
  structures
abstract:
We exploit a natural correspondence between holomorphic
$(2,3,5)$-distributions and nondegenerate lines on holomorphic contact
manifolds of dimension $5$ to present a new perspective in the study of
symmetries of $(2,3,5)$-distributions. This leads to a number of new results in
this classical subject, including an unexpected relation between the
multiply-transitive families of models having $7$- and $6$-dimensional
symmetries, and a one-to-one correspondence between equivalence classes of
nontransitive $(2,3,5)$-distributions with $6$-dimensional symmetries and
nonhomogeneous nondegenerate Legendrian curves in $\mathbb{P}^3$. An ingredient
for establishing the former is an explicit classification of homogeneous
nondegenerate Legendrian curves in $\mathbb{P}^3$, which we present.
